comment: Super great professor, Taught me everything I know about how to use RStudio and statistics

I took this class online. She was very difficult to understand, and constantly repeated certain words in her lectures over and over. After every sentence she would say, "Right?" or "Okay?" 

It drove me nuts.

She is honestly an amazing professor who wants you to learn. Of course she has expectations but that's because she wants you to succeed in future endeavors. She is very understanding and will take the time to explain the lecture and break it down when you have the time.

Great professor. She offers extensions to students and actively tries to make sure that you understand the content. Will answer questions. Lab assignments every week but they're not difficult. The powerpoint slides are easy to read and will present what you need to know. Exams are open book 3 hours long (good).
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Dr. J is very knowledgeable and explains things well. Her exams are tough but fair, and she gives enough time to complete them. She supervised me for the Analytics Day project, and I was impressed by her research skills. She is supportive and encourages students to do their best. If you put in the effort, you will learn a lot. Highly recommend!
Instructor would always take questions and respond with the answer. As well as giving the background information as to why the answer she gave is correct
One of my favorite professors at KSU! Dr. J is very pleasant, kind, and creates a supportive learning environment. Big applause for her excellent teaching and dedication to helping students succeed!

Dr. J's teaching focuses on advanced concepts that go beyond coding, helping us build strong problem-solving skills. Her challenging exams enhance understanding and prepare us for future courses. She is kind, approachable, and encourages questions, fostering a supportive learning environment.

Dr. J spent most of our class discussing theoretical math rather than course curriculum. She was rude to students who asked questions and laughed as our class struggled with the midterm. The content was entirely different from how the course was previously taught and I don't feel that her class prepared me well for future courses in the program.

This was my first STAT class, and I really enjoyed it! Dr. J combines theory with R coding to explain real-world applications. Her lecture notes, R demos, and materials are well-organized and easy to follow. I'd love to take another class with her!

Dr. J is one of my favorite professors at KSU! She is incredibly knowledgeable, and I learned so much about regression analysis. Her guidance was invaluable in preparing my Analytics Day poster. Her teaching style is engaging and inspiring. Highly recommend her!
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class

comment: Dr. J is a kind, knowledgeable instructor who truly cares about her students' success. She actively helps during labs, ensuring everyone understands the material. Her thorough exam reviews and helpful feedback make preparation easier. Students enjoy her supportive teaching and highly recommend her for future classes.

She often provides unclear expectations and gives verbal instructions without written clarification, leading to penalties in labs. She is stressed and brings this into class. The worst is her being critical/making fun of students who struggle to remember past lectures. Questions are ALWAYS met with judgment before being answered, if at all.

At her core is a very nice woman. She is caring about how much students understand and has made her office open to lots of students. She has this breakout sessions in the middle of class where we are all drowned in a topic and she just breaks out of that to talk about her day. It always something funny that cools the air and makes everyone at ease.
